qas.question: Why were instruments more unwelcome to Christians?

answers.text: They were considered a Catholic innovation

qas.question: What was the name of the book in which Jeanie Deans is the protagonist?
Who is quoted for saying instruments in religious services are like "A cow bell in a concert"
Who authored The Heart of the Midlothian?
What was considered an Easter Catholic inovation?
What was first use introduced into worship in the 1800's?
Who opposed a capella music in worship during the 18th century?

plausible_answers.text: the use of an instrument in worship

qas.question: What did Luther refer to as "a cow bell in a concert"?
What has divided Catholics since they have been used in worship?
What did Catholics oppose to be used in worship?

plausible_answers.text: referred to the use of an instrument in worship as "a cow bell in a concert"

qas.question: What did Martin Luther mention about using instruments during church worship?
What did Ulrich Zwingli write that had Jeanie Deans as the heroine?
What type of religion is John Calvin a member of in the book?

context: <b4_0><b5_0><b6_0><b9_0><b10_0>Instruments<b10_0/><b9_0/><b6_0/><b5_0/><b4_0/> have divided Christendom since their introduction into worship. <a0_0>They were considered a Catholic innovation<a0_0/>, not widely practiced until the 18th century, and were opposed vigorously in worship by a number of <b7_0>Protestant Reformers<b7_0/>, including Martin Luther (1483–1546), Ulrich Zwingli, John Calvin (1509–1564) and John Wesley (1703–1791). <a2_0>Alexander Campbell<a2_0/> <b11_0>referred to <b8_0>the use of an instrument in worship<b8_0/> as "a cow bell in a concert"<b11_0/>. In <a3_0>Sir Walter Scott<a3_0/>'s <a1_0><b12_0>The Heart of Midlothian<b12_0/><a1_0/>, the heroine, Jeanie Deans, a <b13_0>Scottish Presbyterian<b13_0/>, writes to her father about the church situation she has found in England (bold added):
